replies.body: No. Permanent bans are permanent.
Ty, please repeat this once a year so ppl don't complain that it's outdated information XD

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=XjEwnrEK,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-02-24T22:53:30.335+0000)
>
> No. Permanent bans are permanent.

Except for when they are not.  People have gotten their accounts back from permaban status.
In the context of being unbanned for the sake of a second chance they really are permanent, though.

per·ma·nent
adjective
1.
existing perpetually; everlasting, especially without significant change.
2.
intended to exist or function for a long, indefinite period without regard to unforeseeable conditions:
a permanent employee; the permanent headquarters of the United Nations.
3.
long-lasting or nonfading:
permanent pleating; permanent ink.
thanks for reply. long time not loge in :))

This is simply not true, I have seen a buddy of mine get his permaban reduced and she was TOXIC, there was no mistake. Riot was nice to her and get her another chance. I have read multiple occasions on reddit, facebook, and elsewhere where people had said their "permanent" ban was altered. You guys say permanent bans are permanent but for many people out there, it wasn't. 

Here's a video I found of some guy who got his permaban reduced to two weeks as well. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7PmK_muMlR4

They tried this before, and it was a spectacular failure as 95% of permabanned players they put back in went right back to the same toxic behavior. Last time I heard they were not looking for a way to do this again;

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=q7NYtdkw,comment-id=0003000100010000000100020001,timestamp=2016-03-09T01:58:12.412+0000)
>
> When we permanently ban players we want them to spend their time elsewhere. Permanent bans are reserved for players who were either extremely toxic (hate speech etc.) or refused to improve after numerous warnings. 
> 
> Chat restrictions are our way of helping players realize their behavior is not acceptable, and shielding their behaviors from other players while allowing them a chance to improve.
> 
> This is why we provide chat logs and information about why we punished them. **We aren't looking for ways to keep extremely toxic players in the community**, which is why we do not issue permanent chat restrictions.

These are community discussion boards, not Riot support tickets. 

Not only are members of the community free to reply, but you have received the information that you have requested. 

It is pretty unlikely that a Riot employee will reply only to repeat the information that you have already been given. 

Also, Riot employee comments are very heavily scrutinized and are often taken as Law & Prophecy by the community at large. 

If they were to even hint at the slightest chance of there being any system being discussed, it would be taken as an announcement of intent.

You are clearly reformed...

You seriously have that audacity to tell other Boards members if they can reply or not? If you wish to discuss things only with Riot employees, submit a ticket and communicate with them via e-mail.

Maybe you should have considered the risk of losing that "500$+++" as an incentive to not flame people. 

It's easy enough for people to create a new account and get around the permanent ban system as it is.

anyway im sure riot know what my account banned and know who im, and its not the think...

to all peoples here if u dont know anything new please dont reply thats it, thanks all.

The only "new" info is that the 95% failure rate was for people Riot Support hand picked because they thought those players had the best chance. 

Only 5% of the most likely candidates passing, with manual selection before that...  there's no way they'd push something like that to the masses. 

Even ***if*** they're considering a new system (and I don't think they are), it would be in the same hand-picked style as the last one for a first pass. If you wanted to have a shot of getting the old account back (again, assuming such a system get tried again) you'd need to show *exceptionally* good behavior on your new account as well as have a few *very polite* support tickets so that someone thought of your case specifically when they were picking people. I'm not even sure what you could talk about for several tickets, and you'd most likely get canned responses back.

I think you've got a better chance of winning your $500 back from a lottery than you have of getting the account back.

They probably don't have anything new. They wouldn't run back the old program because it already failed. Why would they bring back something that doesn't work? I mean unless you have some sort of suggestion to help reform people a topic like this really isn't eloping mainly because you are basically asking for more chances. You had them and still failed to reform, so why would another one help you if they didn't work the other times?
What do you mean "second"? You already got 3 chances to reform before getting the permanent ban. How many more chances would you want?

The latest thing that was said from Riot Tantram in this regards (and I'm power phrasing here cos I can't find the thread) were as follows (this was within the last 3-6 months):

> Permabans is our way of telling someone they aren't welcome in our game, not to make it easier for them to come back.

and 

> There is a diminishing return upon every punishment tier we work on, it is more beneficial for us to spend our resources where we can get a better impact.

Meaning they rather spend time creating features that can benefit 100% of the population, instead of a feature that may / may not work for 0.006% of the population.

So that also means: no new programs for the small minor population, probably new features coming for the majority of us. 

Even if they had new features for 100% of the population, they aren't sharing any details with us and have been super quiet about it. They'll tease us here and there with some smiley emojis when we are suggesting things, but that's all they are telling us.
ok thank you
